intro: Noccaea brachypetala subsp. tatrensis, commonly known as the Tatran narrowleafed honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Central European Alps. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white flowers and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions of the Czech Republic and Austria. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
